head.title: When School and Home Are One

hedline.hl1: When School and Home Are One

abstract.p: Meg Kelleher Frick letter, commenting on May 24 article on home schooling, says the schedule one of the home-schooled students keeps seems like that of a retiree; cartoon

block.p: The schedule maintained by Dean Palmiter, one of the home-schooled children described in ''Learning at Home, Students Take the Lead'' (front page, May 24), sounds familiar: ''He gets up late, at 9,'' gets ''his phone calls made and his newspaper read before 11'' and ''reads voraciously.''

The schedule maintained by Dean Palmiter, one of the home-schooled children described in ''Learning at Home, Students Take the Lead'' (front page, May 24), sounds familiar: ''He gets up late, at 9,'' gets ''his phone calls made and his newspaper read before 11'' and ''reads voraciously.''
It's the lifestyle of millions of Americans who love it and can't imagine how they ever lived any other way. They're retired.
MEG KELLEHER FRICK Mendham, N.J., May 24, 2000
